series_description: This series documents the 1939 movement of the Aluminum
retention_statement: Transfer records to the , Library of Virginia for permanent retention.

series_title: Capitol Square Review and Advisory Commission Records
series_description: This series documents the actions of a temporary commission established by the general assembly to review the preservation status of Capitol Square. One recommendation of the Commission was the establishment of permanent Capitol Square Preservation Council. Defunct series.
retention_statement: Transfer records to the , Library of Virginia for permanent retention.

series_description: This series documents the official actions of the Capitol Square Preservation Council and includes the official minutes of the Council. Refer to
retention_statement: Retain in agency until no longer administratively useful, then transfer records to the , Library of Virginia for permanent retention.

series_title: Director's Research and Historical Records This series includes historical and research records, collected by the Director, related to Capitol Square; it's history, buildings and landscaping. Includes materials on the history of the land.
retention_statement: Retain in agency until no longer administratively useful, then transfer records to the , Library of Virginia for permanent retention.

series_description: This series documents any fundraising activity conducted by the Council and its Director.
retention_statement: Retain in accordance with conditions of gifts or grants or 3 years after expenditure of all related funds or 3 years after last contact with donor; whichever is greater, then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on schedule cover page.

series_title: Executive Mansion Restoration Files This series includes records of the Historic Richmond Foundation, donated to the Council, in relation to restoration of the Governor's Mansion. Defunct series .
retention_statement: Transfer records to the , Library of Virginia for permanent retention.

series_description: This series documents the routine management of the office and includes but is not limited to correspondence, subject files, chronological files and the Director's lecture notes.
This series consists of photographs, collected, produced, and purchased by or donated to the Council, related to Capitol Square.
retention_statement: After scanning and inclusion of images into records series 005290, "Director's Research and Historical Records", transfer photographs to the custody of the Picture Collection, Library of Virginia for preservation, storage and management.
